description: Manage file shares that use the SMB 3.0 protocol.

commands.name: az storage file delete
commands.summary: Mark the specified file for deletion.
commands.syntax:
az storage file delete --path
                       --share-name
                       [--account-key]
                       [--account-name]
                       [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                       [--backup-intent]
                       [--connection-string]
                       [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                       [--file-endpoint]
                       [--sas-token]
                       [--timeout]

commands.name: az storage file delete
commands.summary: Mark the specified file for deletion.
commands.syntax:
az storage file delete --path
                       --share-name
                       [--account-key]
                       [--account-name]
                       [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                       [--backup-intent]
                       [--connection-string]
                       [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                       [--sas-token]
                       [--timeout]

commands.name: az storage file delete-batch
commands.summary: Delete files from an Azure Storage File Share.
commands.syntax:
az storage file delete-batch --source
                             [--account-key]
                             [--account-name]
                             [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                             [--backup-intent]
                             [--connection-string]
                             [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                             [--dryrun]
                             [--file-endpoint]
                             [--pattern]
                             [--sas-token]
                             [--timeout]
examples: az storage file delete-batch --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --source /path/to/file
az storage file delete-batch --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --pattern "*.py" --source /path/to/file

commands.name: az storage file delete-batch
commands.summary: Delete files from an Azure Storage File Share.
commands.syntax:
az storage file delete-batch --source
                             [--account-key]
                             [--account-name]
                             [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                             [--backup-intent]
                             [--connection-string]
                             [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                             [--dryrun]
                             [--pattern]
                             [--sas-token]
                             [--timeout]
examples: az storage file delete-batch --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --source /path/to/file
az storage file delete-batch --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --pattern *.py --source /path/to/file

commands.name: az storage file download
commands.summary: Download a file to a file path, with automatic chunking and progress notifications.
commands.syntax:
az storage file download --path
                         --share-name
                         [--account-key]
                         [--account-name]
                         [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                         [--backup-intent]
                         [--connection-string]
                         [--dest]
                         [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                         [--end-range]
                         [--file-endpoint]
                         [--max-connections]
                         [--no-progress]
                         [--open-mode]
                         [--sas-token]
                         [--snapshot]
                         [--start-range]
                         [--timeout]
                         [--validate-content]

commands.name: az storage file download
commands.summary: Download a file to a file path, with automatic chunking and progress notifications.
commands.syntax:
az storage file download --path

                         [--account-name]

                         [--end-range]
                         [--max-connections]

                         [--open-mode]

                         [--snapshot]
                         [--start-range]
                         [--timeout]
                         [--validate-content]

commands.name: az storage file download-batch
commands.summary: Download files from an Azure Storage File Share to a local directory in a batch operation.
commands.syntax:
az storage file download-batch --destination
                               --source
                               [--account-key]
                               [--account-name]
                               [--connection-string]
                               [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                               [--dryrun]
                               [--file-endpoint]
                               [--max-connections]
                               [--no-progress]
                               [--pattern]
                               [--sas-token]
                               [--snapshot]
                               [--validate-content]
examples: az storage file download-batch --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --destination . --no-progress --source /path/to/file

commands.name: az storage file download-batch
commands.summary: Download files from an Azure Storage File Share to a local directory in a batch operation.
commands.syntax:
az storage file download-batch --destination
                               --source
                               [--account-key]
                               [--account-name]
                               [--connection-string]
                               [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                               [--dryrun]
                               [--max-connections]
                               [--no-progress]
                               [--pattern]
                               [--sas-token]
                               [--snapshot]
                               [--validate-content]
examples: az storage file download-batch --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --destination . --no-progress --source /path/to/file

commands.name: az storage file exists
commands.summary: Check for the existence of a file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file exists --path
                       --share-name
                       [--account-key]
                       [--account-name]
                       [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                       [--backup-intent]
                       [--connection-string]
                       [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                       [--file-endpoint]
                       [--sas-token]
                       [--snapshot]
                       [--timeout]
examples: az storage file exists --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --path path/file.txt --share-name MyShare
az storage file exists --connection-string $connectionString --path path/file.txt --share-name MyShare

commands.name: az storage file exists
commands.summary: Check for the existence of a file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file exists --path
                       --share-name
                       [--account-key]
                       [--account-name]
                       [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                       [--backup-intent]
                       [--connection-string]
                       [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                       [--sas-token]
                       [--snapshot]
                       [--timeout]
examples: az storage file exists --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyAccount --path path/file.txt --share-name MyShare
az storage file exists --connection-string $connectionString --path path/file.txt --share-name MyShare

commands.name: az storage file generate-sas
commands.summary: Generate a shared access signature for the file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file generate-sas --path
                             --share-name
                             [--account-key]
                             [--account-name]
                             [--cache-control]
                             [--connection-string]
                             [--content-disposition]
                             [--content-encoding]
                             [--content-language]
                             [--content-type]
                             [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                             [--expiry]
                             [--file-endpoint]
                             [--https-only]
                             [--ip]
                             [--permissions]
                             [--policy-name]
                             [--start]
examples:
end=`date -u -d "30 minutes" '+%Y-%m-%dT%H:%MZ'`
az storage file generate-sas -p path/file.txt -s MyShare --account-name MyStorageAccount --permissions rcdw --https-only --expiry $end
az storage file generate-sas --account-name MyStorageAccount --expiry 2037-12-31T23:59:00Z --path path/file.txt --permissions rcdw --share-name MyShare --start 2019-01-01T12:20Z
az storage file generate-sas --account-key 00000000 --account-name mystorageaccount --expiry 2037-12-31T23:59:00Z --https-only --path path/file.txt --permissions rcdw --share-name myshare

commands.name: az storage file generate-sas
commands.summary: Generate a shared access signature for the file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file generate-sas --path

                             [--policy-name]

az storage file generate-sas -p path/file.txt -s MyShare --account-name MyStorageAccount --permissions rcdw --https-only --expiry $end
az storage file generate-sas --account-name MyStorageAccount --expiry 2037-12-31T23:59:00Z --path path/file.txt --permissions rcdw --share-name MyShare --start 2019-01-01T12:20Z
az storage file generate-sas --account-key 00000000 --account-name mystorageaccount --expiry 2037-12-31T23:59:00Z --https-only --path path/file.txt --permissions rcdw --share-name myshare

commands.name: az storage file list
commands.summary: List files and directories in a share.
commands.syntax:
az storage file list --share-name
                     [--account-key]
                     [--account-name]
                     [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                     [--backup-intent]
                     [--connection-string]
                     [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                     [--exclude-dir]
                     [--exclude-extended-info]
                     [--file-endpoint]
                     [--marker]
                     [--num-results]
                     [--path]
                     [--sas-token]
                     [--snapshot]
                     [--timeout]
examples: az storage file list --share-name MyShare

commands.name: az storage file list
commands.summary: List files and directories in a share.
commands.syntax:
az storage file list --share-name
                     [--account-key]
                     [--account-name]
                     [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                     [--backup-intent]
                     [--connection-string]
                     [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                     [--exclude-dir]
                     [--exclude-extended-info]
                     [--marker]
                     [--num-results]
                     [--path]
                     [--sas-token]
                     [--snapshot]
                     [--timeout]
examples: az storage file list --share-name MyShare

commands.name: az storage file resize
commands.summary: Resize a file to the specified size.
commands.syntax:
az storage file resize --path
                       --share-name
                       --size
                       [--account-key]
                       [--account-name]
                       [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                       [--backup-intent]
                       [--connection-string]
                       [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                       [--file-endpoint]
                       [--sas-token]
                       [--timeout]

commands.name: az storage file resize
commands.summary: Resize a file to the specified size.
commands.syntax:
az storage file resize --path
                       --share-name
                       --size
                       [--account-key]
                       [--account-name]
                       [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                       [--backup-intent]
                       [--connection-string]
                       [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                       [--sas-token]
                       [--timeout]

commands.name: az storage file show
commands.summary: Return all user-defined metadata, standard HTTP properties, and system properties for the file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file show --path
                     --share-name
                     [--account-key]
                     [--account-name]
                     [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                     [--backup-intent]
                     [--connection-string]
                     [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                     [--file-endpoint]
                     [--sas-token]
                     [--snapshot]
                     [--timeout]
examples: az storage file show -p dir/a.txt -s sharename --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000

commands.name: az storage file show
commands.summary: Return all user-defined metadata, standard HTTP properties, and system properties for the file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file show --path
                     --share-name

                     [--snapshot]
                     [--timeout]
examples: az storage file show -p dir/a.txt -s sharename --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000

commands.name: az storage file update
commands.summary: Set system properties on the file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file update --path
                       --share-name
                       [--account-key]
                       [--account-name]
                       [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                       [--backup-intent]
                       [--clear-content-settings {false, true}]
                       [--connection-string]
                       [--content-cache]
                       [--content-disposition]
                       [--content-encoding]
                       [--content-language]
                       [--content-md5]
                       [--content-type]
                       [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                       [--file-endpoint]
                       [--sas-token]
                       [--timeout]
examples: az storage file update -p dir/a.txt -s sharename --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000 --content-type test/type

commands.name: az storage file update
commands.summary: Set system properties on the file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file update --path
                       --share-name
                       [--account-key]

                       [--content-cache]
                       [--content-disposition]
                       [--content-encoding]
                       [--content-language]
                       [--content-md5]
                       [--content-type]
                       [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]

examples: az storage file update -p dir/a.txt -s sharename --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000 --content-type test/type

commands.name: az storage file upload
commands.summary: Upload a file to a share that uses the SMB 3.0 protocol.
commands.syntax:
az storage file upload --source
                       [--account-key]
                       [--account-name]
                       [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                       [--backup-intent]
                       [--connection-string]
                       [--content-cache]
                       [--content-disposition]
                       [--content-encoding]
                       [--content-language]
                       [--content-md5]
                       [--content-type]
                       [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                       [--file-endpoint]
                       [--file-url]
                       [--max-connections]
                       [--metadata]
                       [--no-progress]
                       [--path]
                       [--sas-token]
                       [--share-name]
                       [--timeout]
                       [--validate-content]
examples: az storage file upload -s MyShare --source /path/to/file
az storage file upload --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyStorageAccount --path path/file.txt --share-name MyShare --source /path/to/file

commands.name: az storage file upload

az storage file upload --account-key 00000000 --account-name MyStorageAccount --path path/file.txt --share-name MyShare --source /path/to/file

commands.name: az storage file upload-batch
commands.summary: Upload files from a local directory to an Azure Storage File Share in a batch operation.
commands.syntax:
az storage file upload-batch --destination
                             --source
                             [--account-key]
                             [--account-name]
                             [--connection-string]
                             [--content-cache]
                             [--content-disposition]
                             [--content-encoding]
                             [--content-language]
                             [--content-md5]
                             [--content-type]
                             [--destination-path]
                             [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                             [--dryrun]
                             [--file-endpoint]
                             [--max-connections]
                             [--metadata]
                             [--no-progress]
                             [--pattern]
                             [--sas-token]
                             [--validate-content]
examples: az storage file upload-batch --destination myshare --source . --account-name myaccount --account-key 00000000
az storage file upload-batch --destination https://myaccount.file.core.windows.net/myshare --source . --account-key 00000000

commands.name: az storage file upload-batch
commands.summary: Upload files from a local directory to an Azure Storage File Share in a batch operation.
commands.syntax:
az storage file upload-batch --destination
                             --source
                             [--account-key]
                             [--account-name]
                             [--connection-string]
                             [--content-cache]

az storage file upload-batch --destination https://myaccount.file.core.windows.net/myshare --source . --account-key 00000000

commands.name: az storage file url
commands.summary: Create the url to access a file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file url --path
                    --share-name
                    [--account-key]
                    [--account-name]
                    [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                    [--backup-intent]
                    [--connection-string]
                    [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                    [--file-endpoint]
                    [--protocol {http, https}]
                    [--sas-token]
examples: az storage file url --account-key 00000000 --account-name mystorageaccount --path path/file.txt --share-name myshare

commands.name: az storage file url
commands.summary: Create the url to access a file.
commands.syntax:
az storage file url --path
                    --share-name
                    [--account-key]
                    [--account-name]
                    [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                    [--backup-intent]
                    [--connection-string]
                    [--disallow-trailing-dot {false, true}]
                    [--protocol {http, https}]
                    [--sas-token]
examples: az storage file url --account-key 00000000 --account-name mystorageaccount --path path/file.txt --share-name myshare
